title: Instead of nerfing useless shit like base damage on ult, move Lee Sins power away from his Q
body:
Currently the game is broken down into a single question.

"Did Lee Sin land Q? "


If yes, you die.
If no, you live until the next time the question is asked.


The only reason his ult seemed like such a huge chunk was the 100% chance to land his Q after it.

Has anyone even noticed the damage on his E? It is like he farted in your general direction, no change to your health.


But instead of addressing the issue, I suspect Riot will just continue with their current mindset.

"We just nerfed him guys, we don't want to spend too long on one champ, especially one with a high impact in comp. When he dominates the jungle scene for another 5 years, we will come back and lower his Q damage by about 50 aswell"

I don't really care whether or not it's imagineable without ward hopping. The FACT that they've admitted to playing favorites because they refuse to let something go that wasn't intended to be a thing WITHOUT adjusting the power of his kit to be balanced around it is just petty and childish.

He is balanced around ward-hopping though, it allows Riot to make his Q hit minions and champs because he has a prime repositioning tool to angle it, and it allows his E to have almost no radius because he can ward hop on top of people.

You can say what you want, but if Lee couldn't ward hop he'd get something that probably even stronger to compensate since he can run out of wards to use on his own already.

Lee also uses ward hops as a free escape, or as gapcloser in a gank so he can apply his E slow and redbuff befor takeing his chances with Q, or wardstep into ult into Q, especially over walls underneath the opposing tower.
IF hsi wardstep was just for insec, fine, but it makes his ganks braindead easy if he's just somewhat competent, and gives him always an easy way out off bad situations.

Also, flanks still work to get into a position for a good kick, so does flash.

His Q is hardly a skill shot considering he can root/knock up/stun/root you again with the push of a button, additionally most of his kit + item choices allows him to frankly get up into your face, slow you by a stupidly high amount, and then Q you.

As for falling off of a cliff? Most games are pretty much over right by then, so that's hardly relevant. Lethality items are weaker than crit at 30, but you don't really see crit items. 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

Catching up to lee sin isn't a problem. He has a gap closer escape just like tons of other chanps. I don't understand why you think only those champs that you listed can catch up to him. I could list a ton of other champs that can catch him but that would take too long because there's too many. 

Lee does not have a root. It's a knock back unless he hits that person into another person in which they get knocked up. This is a healthy mechanic which only happens if you are a skillful Lee player or they just happen to line or group up in which should not be happening just like you are playing against any other wombo champion except lee kick is easier to not get womboed by. 

You say they get knocked up/root etc "AGAIN", but you only get knocked up once. He doesn't cc the same champion twice.

His kit only allows for an easy slow early game but when teamfighting comes around, if he ward hops into your team to slow he is taking a lot of free damage. The slow isn't huge. It's a 20% slow level 1 and max level it is 60%. The slow lasts 4 seconds but decays over the 4 seconds. That's not that big of a slow.

The only reason crit isn't optimal now is because lethality is broken. Lee sin isn't broken. Just because lee sin may be annoying to you doesn't mean he's broken. I think lee is in a very good spot currently and that's how most players that are good at the game say.

I don't really understand how it's "not intended." It's been in for how long now? At that point, the whole "not intended" logic is flat-out incorrect, considering it's pretty clear that even if it wasn't intended when they first released him, they've retroactively made it intended.

Not intendet because back when lee was designed and then released, wardsteps were not a thing. 
And later when they became possible, they were not as nig of a deal because they had huge opportunity costs, 75g per ward and one inventory slot with no stats at all.
But ever since sightstone, lee became absurd becuase the frequent wardsteps broke his kit, and in return he got tonsoff nerfs, like getting his AS slow removed, or getting his W armor s#boost removed, and generally getting most numbers reduced...

The only reason why they kept it is because when it comes to lee, they actually fear the community backlash. They even had it removed on PBE at one point befor the lee mains got mad and they pulled it back. 
And that they choose to keep it doesn't change a thing about it breaking his kit by covering weaknesses that were intendet in his origiinal desing. Even now after all the nerfs, his kit can still be called overloaded, and that all was balanced out by him beeing gated in some way. But with wardhops, that gateing ceases to exist.

"original design" is irrelevant. Especially with Riot - need I point out all the reworks that have changed the champions pretty fundamentally?

Also, this all reads like wardhopping was a very, _very_ recent tech, that was only just now popularized. But all of those nerfs that intend to balance him? They were all made with wardhopping _in mind_. Not to mention, it's likely not just the community keeping it on Lee - even if they likely wish they could knock him down a peg without getting skinned alive, it's pretty obviously that Riot themselves love how flashy and skillful he can be. I really can't see wardhopping being removed without just flat-out giving Lee another way to accomplish exactly the same thing ... which would mostly likely _free up an item slot_ and end up being more of a buff than anything.

Besides, wardhopping is entirely a _mobility_ thing, which even without it Lee doesn't exactly struggle with. It doesn't exactly remove a weakness, moreso just makes a strength stronger.
If that means him getting compensated like Katarina did... I'd rather they don't remove the ward hop.

Without wardhop the insec move will not exist anymore so lee will be totally trash and useless in competitive play and ofc no ones will play him in solo q. 

A good nerf would be lower the E damage and make a higher cooldown and return to reveal invisible targets.
